page.title: 02FARMING IN KIRKBY LONSDALE
page.content: In the predominantly rural setting of Kirkby Lonsdale,agriculture plays an important part.In the Lune Valley there are some farms which have{dairy {cattle}but on the higher, rough grazing land{sheep}form the major activity.Unlike some areas,field boundaries have not been destroyed to make larger,more economical fields. This is because there is{little arable {farming}and also because the field boundaries are old{dry stone walls which are hard to remove.However some walls are holed to allow freer access of animals,and some are crumbling through age.It is encouraging to see that the{old skills}of dry stone walling are still practiced.There has been,as a result of farming in this area,no serious threat to conservation or wildlife.
